intro: Fumana viscida var. barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's fumana, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is a climbing shrub that belongs to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are small capsules that release seeds through dehiscence, aiding in seed dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically fragile species.
